post_info.post_title: sorry, Bush, no equity pumping this time

Well, eventough he's backing reform without private accounts, he still can't let go of the idea of equity pumping:
 
 "This in no way should be interpreted to mean that the president is backing off of personal accounts," White House spokesman Trent Duffy said. "He is not."
 
 Maybe he's backing the reform plans without private accounts because it has a bigger chance of passing while at the same time making people more comfortable with the idea of SS reform. Once the reform train has picked up steam he'll probably give the private accounts plan another try, thinking this time it will have a greater chance of succeeding.
